content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task that requires me to:
1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill
4. Write and execute a test
5. Email a progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring these repositories to understand what's available. I'll need to clone or fetch information from these repos.

Let me first check what's already in the current environment and then explore the repositories.

I should:
1. First check the current skills available in .pi/skills/ and pi-skills/
2. Clone or explore the three GitHub repositories
3. Identify new tools/skills/architectures
4. Pick the best one and implement it
5. Test it
6. Send an email report

Let me start by exploring what's currently available and then clone the repositories to examine them.

content.text: I'll systematically scan the three repositories, identify the best new idea, implement it as a skill, test it, and send you a progress report. Let me start by exploring the repositories.

<function=bash>
<parameter=command>
find /job/tmp/zeroclaw -type f -name "*.md" | head -30
</parameter>
</function>
</tool_call>
<tool_call>

find /job/tmp/openclaw -type f -name "*.md" | head -30
</parameter>
</function>
</tool_call>

find /job/tmp/thepopebot -type f -name "*.md" | head -30
</parameter>
